p: Therefore, the use of natural antimicrobial and antioxidant compounds in biodegradable films tends to contribute to the preservation of food quality and safety. An example of this was observed when the incorporation of tea polyphenol into a film made with pomelo peel flour caused an antimicrobial effect on the film; as its concentration was increased from 5 to 20%, there was an increase in the inhibition zone for Escherichia coli and Staphylococcus aureus around the films. Films without tea polyphenol did not show antimicrobial effect, proving that it was the tea that generated this property [ 28].
